name: InterContinental Budapest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, in the centre of Budapest, with the greatest view of the Danube. We arrived at 7.30 in the morning and although we couldn't check in, we're offered a room with a view of the Danube at the 9th floor with an extra cost of 25 euro per night.
reviews.title: Wonderful view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: The agency that have booked me the hotel had booked room with a view at the street, and since 25 euros per night didn't seem so many we took it.
reviews.title: Great staff, average facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: We entered the room, and slept for 4 hours and I could say that I was very satisfied with their attitude.
reviews.title: Amazing weekend made complete with a stay at the Intercontinental

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only problem that I had were the matresses. Unfortunately they are old, and they made my back heart after a night's sleep.
reviews.title: The view !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The morning breakfast was excellent, and the whole experience is truly great.
reviews.title: Great location, good hotel, lovely city!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Decided on booking this hotel purely for the views it offered of the river, and we weren't disappointed. Being able to see the Palace/White House etc. from our room was fantastic, particularly as the sun set. On top of this, the hotel is perfectly situated for exploring both Buda and Pest on foot.
reviews.title: Worth it for the river view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Staff were professional and efficient, rooms a bit on the small side. Otherwise very good and had all the amenities you'd expect.
reviews.title: Awesome river view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Hotel upgraded my room to a river view and it was amazing! Large windows look out at the Danube, the bridges between Buda and Pest sides of the city, the castle and the parliament building. Hotel was otherwise quite nice but nothing outstanding about decor or services. BUT the riverview makes it worth staying there.
reviews.title: Best Place to See Budapest from

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm Marriott loyal for cleanliness, smoke-free, great beds, senior discount, and points program. But I booked my "airline safety" days at the InterContinental Budapest where my tour was starting, though it cost more for a Danube view room, for I wanted to avoid the inconvenience of switching hotels. I found that would not be a problem. The Marriott and the InterContinental occupy prime Danube frontage in the same block, and one can easily roll one's luggage from one hotel to the other along the broad riverside pedestrian walkway. Marriott claims every room is riverview; InterContinental is about 50-50. Both hotels are expensive, but, believe me, if you are on vacation in Budapest, you want Danube view!
reviews.title: Great position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At night your riverview room gives you a panorama of the historic structures across the river on Castle Hill in Buda, illuminated. Fantastic! By day you have the activities of the riverboats and the riverside tram. The InterContinental has the advantage of being sited right at the Pest end of the famous Chain Bridge, so from this hotel there is all the bridge activity to watch, as well. (Full disclosure: a Sofitel, in second-row behind the InterContinental, has some riverview rooms but not riverwalk frontage.)
reviews.title: Amazing views and great location win over price-gouging

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I am writing this review many years after staying in this hotel. We stayed in the InterContinental Budapest in the summer of 2004, for a few nights. (Note, Tripadvisor.com does not let me select the travel dates any earlier than Dec. 2010, so that was what I selected. But the actual dates of our stay was in the summer of 2004).
reviews.title: The best hotel I ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: After so many years, looking back, I still feel it was the best hotel I have ever stayed in. We had a stunning view of the river and the architecture/landscape on the other side of the shore. I recall the view took my breath away when I first entered the room. The other memorable thing about our stay was the food. We had the best buffet breakfast ever! The choice of food was unbelievable. The variety of different types of bread and cheese was incredible, but that's not all, they even had sushi and oriental dishes for breakfast. It was true to its name -- Intercontinental. We haven't been back to that part of the world since that trip. I truly hope the hotel has kept its excellent service and food. I would definitely like to visit there again some day, and would go back to this hotel.
reviews.title: Best Hotel to stay in Budapest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy to reach all sights in Budapest, riverview rooms offer an amazing view towards river, Castle and Fischerbastei.
reviews.title: Fantastic as always

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kids loved staying there not only because of receiving nie Teddy bears, but also cause of excellent breakfast, Swimmingpool....
reviews.title: Great Hotel, great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Great Layout of rooms and in Family Room enough space to store everything. If you want to find something negative - the bathroom is rather small....
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: excellant service, location was excellant to Budapest attractions, breakfast was excellent with a great choice available
reviews.title: excellant hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: My husband stayed here for four nights. The location is perfect for walking to most sites. Comments about the reception area and restaurant being smokey are true. This is a problem in many europeon countries. I would strongly recommend paying for club access and foregoing a room with a view. The club has the view as well as a great breakfast, afternoon snacks and happy hour with hot and cold food that can easily be dinner. And, it is no smoking as well as a quiet place to relax and read when you want to take a break. Wifi is free with lounge access only. Several computers are also available for guests.
reviews.title: Great location, club access a must

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The only complaint I have with the hotel is that the room doors slam when closing. I realize this is a common problem with most hotels, but it disturbs an otherwise quiet comfortable sleep.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but Smokey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Location but reception can be very smokey. We took my inlaws there for a night and had a suite with an additional adjoining bedroom. Great views over the danube.
reviews.title: Luxury hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I've been there on business I've ordered room service but this is really not very good (cold food, poor quality). There are plenty of restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: What a View!!!!!

description: The InterContinental Budapest hotel is situated directly by the Chain bridge overlooking the Royal Palace. This impressive hotel offers 402 beautifully appointed guestrooms, many of which enjoy a fabulous river-view. You may also choose from 18 exquisite Suites and a Presidential Suite. State-de-art conference facilities with capacity up to 900 person; 10 breakout rooms; Club Lounge with a breathtaking view of the Danube; SPA; 24 hr Fitness Centre, swimming pool, steam room and sauna; All day dining Corso Restaurant, Bar. An ideal choice for business and leisure travellers.
